The Las Culturistas Culture Awards celebrate pop culture’s most iconic events of the year, with a little bit of nonsense and whimsy, too, as Rogers and Yang present more than 100 awards throughout the night.

While the show is in its fourth year, 2025 marks the first time the awards will be televised, airing at 9 p.m. on Bravo on Aug. 5, and streaming the next day on Peacock on Aug. 6. (TODAY and Bravo are owned by the same parent company, NBCUniversal.)
Jenna and Hoda Kotb won the same award last year, beating out stiff competition like cold brew coffee and bird watching between 6 and 11 a.m., among others.
Hoda and Jenna did not attend the ceremony, but they sent in a video to accept the award. In the clip, the pair jumped up and down and shouted, “We won!”

title: Bowen Yang Brought His Labubu to TODAY — and Craig Gave It a Special Gift
summary: Craig Melvin gave Bowen Yang a special gift for his Labubu doll when the comedian stopped by the  TODAY show to talk about the Las Culturistas Culture Awards.
story: Bowen Yang was shocked when he saw the special gift that Craig Melvin gave him on TODAY.
During an Aug. 5 appearance on the show, Yang showed off his new Labubu doll that he wore around his waist.

"I want to see a guru about infusing fragments of my soul into it or something. It has that power — that, like, demonic power," he shared of the popular toy that's been dubbed the new “it girl” accessory of 2025.
When asked to share his Labubu's name, Yang replied, "We don't have one for it yet." However, he said that he did want to call it Melvin, in honor of the doll's first TV appearance with Craig.
"I didn't even know you were going to name him after me. I got a present without knowing that," Craig said.
Craig then showed off Yang's gift: a small TODAY T-shirt for his Labubu doll.
"Oh my God! Melvin has a little TODAY show shirt!" Yang screamed.
"We wanted Melvin out in the world representing," Craig added before giving Melvin a little kiss on the forehead.

Later on during the 3rd hour of TODAY, Yang appeared again to talk about his new award show, Las Culturistas Culture Awards. However, this time he was seen on camera with Melvin wearing the TODAY shirt.
While speaking with TODAY.com backstage, Yang explains how he got the viral little creature. The dolls retail from under $25 to $100 but can be resold for hundreds of dollars online.

"I got Melvin not in China and Melvin may or may not be authentic," he says. "It's not relevant. What's relevant is I have a material connection to Melvin when I hold him, or when he hangs off my bag or my belt loop. And he has been officially styled by the TODAY show team with this amazing branded T-shirt."

title: Carrie Underwood Brings Back Natural Hair Color That She Last Rocked at 12
summary: Carrie Underwood revealed she's returned to her natural hair color in an Instagram post.
story: Known for her flowing blond locks, Carrie Underwood is switching things up.
The “Before He Cheats” singer, 42, has revealed she’s returned to her natural hair color. Underwood sported the blond-brown hair in an Instagram post on Aug. 4.

“Well, the last time I saw my natural hair color, I was probably about 12 years old, but I thought it might be time to give it a second chance,” she captioned a pair of photos and a video of her rocking the new color.

Underwood, who rocketed to fame after winning the fourth season of “American Idol” in 2005, also thanked Nashville-based hairstylist Katelin Megert for “helping me get back to my roots,” before ending the post with the hash tags #NewOldMe and #Bronde.
People on social media expressed their approval of the new color.
“So pretty!!!!!” commented Candace Cameron Bure.
“Love it!” wrote Kristin Chenoweth.
“WOW 🔥,” wrote Breanna Nix, who competed on the most recent season of “American Idol,” which featured Underwood as a judge.
“Yaaass love this color 👏👏👏” Nix’s fellow “American Idol” contestant Amanda Barise wrote.
“Girl! What a rich and luxurious cut, highlights/lowlights,….you wear it well!!!” another fan raved.
“This looks so good on you!” gushed someone else.
Underwood's blond hair has been as much of a staple as her hitting the hardest notes.
“I’d love to do a little more with hair color. I’ve always been blonde!” she told Refinery29 in 2012.

“The problem is, I don’t want to shock people — like if I dyed my hair brown, I don’t want people think I’m turning dark and serious. I wish I had started changing my hair around in the beginning, then it wouldn’t be such a big shock if I did something like that now.”
Underwood, who shares sons Isaiah, 10, and Jacob, 6, with husband Mike Fisher, had previously gone shorter with her hair length, explaining her family was the impetus for the decision.

“Cutting my hair was a ‘mom’ move,” she told Elle in 2016 after Isaiah was born. “I could spend half an hour to blow it dry and have it be super long, or I could spend that time playing with my son, and I’d much rather do the latter.”

title: EXCLUSIVE: Cast of the New 'Harry Potter' Audiobook Editions Is Revealed
summary: New "Harry Potter" audiobooks are on the way. See the cast and find out the release date of the new Harry Potter audiobooks.
story: New "Harry Potter" audiobooks are on the way, and they sound pretty magical.
On Aug. 5, Pottermore Publishing and Audible, Inc. announced that fans of the Wizarding World can look forward to brand-new productions of the original seven books starting later this year.
"Harry Potter: The Full-Cast Audio Editions" will feature a cast of over 200 performers who will bring the iconic series to life in an exciting new way.
Here's everything you need to know about the new audiobooks before they're released.
When Do the Full-Cast 'Harry Potter' Audiobooks Come Out?
